required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Transplantation of Autologous CD34+ Cells Transduced With the G2ARTE Lentiviral Vector Expressing the DCLRE1C cDNA in Artemis (DCLRE1C) Deficient Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Patients (ARTEGENE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Open Label Non Randomized Study, Multicentric, Single Arm Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Gene Therapy of the Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID) Caused by Mutations in the Human DCLRE1C Gene (Artemis) by Transplantation of a Single Dose of Autologous CD34+ Cells Transduced ex Vivo With the G2ARTE Lentiviral Vector Expressing the DCLRE1C cDNA

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Gene Therapy of the severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) caused by mutations in the human DCLRE1C gene (Artemis) by transplantation of a single dose of autologous CD34+ cells transduced ex vivo with the G2ARTE lentiviral vector expressing the DCLRE1C cDNA.

primary_outcome.measure: Transgene copy number on peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs)
Transgene copy number on sorted cell populations
primary_outcome.description: Determined on sorted cell populations CD15+,CD14+, CD19+, CD56+ and CD3+ T lymphocytes by qPCR

primary_outcome.measure: Absence of any severe adverse events due to insertional mutagenesis

primary_outcome.time_frame: At Day 0, 12 months and 24 months post treatment
primary_outcome.description: by RT-qPCR performed on the transduced CD34+ cells in the drug substance and on peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC)
Frequency and severity of clinical AEs and changes in laboratory parameters

primary_outcome.measure: Transgene copy number in the transduced CD34+ cells in the drug substance
Change in total number of T cells
Change in distribution of different subpopulations
primary_outcome.description: by flow cytometry, according to the WBC count: Naïve and activated/memory CD4+ and CD8+ T cells will be evaluated using CCR7/CD45RA/CD45RO markers. Early thymic emigrants will be monitored by detecting CD31+CD45RA+CD4+ T lymphocytes; Stem cell-like memory CD8+ and CD4+ T cells will be quantified by counting CCR7+CD45RA+CD8+ T cells. Evaluation of the distribution of TCRαβ and TCRγδ T cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in T lymphocyte in vitro proliferation in the presence of mitogens and antigens
Change in repertoire of T lymphocytes
primary_outcome.description: via high-throughput sequencing of the TCR

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the B lymphocyte compartment
primary_outcome.description: analysis of the circulating B cell subpopulations by flow cytometry: total CD19+ cells, naive (CD19+IgD+CD27-), switched memory (CD19+IgD-CD27+), marginal zone (CD19+IgD+CD27+), transitional (CD19+IgD+CD27-CD24highCD38+), 21low (CD19+CD38-CD21low). Immunoglobulin levels (IgG, A, M and E) and specific antibody production after immunization (if applicable)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the B lymphocyte compartment
primary_outcome.description: analysis of the circulating B cell subpopulations by flow cytometry: total CD19+ cells, naive (CD19+IgD+CD27-), switched memory (CD19+IgD-CD27+), marginal zone (CD19+IgD+CD27+), transitional (CD19+IgD+CD27-CD24highCD38+), 21low (CD19+CD38-CD21low). Immunoglobulin levels (IgG, A, M and E) and specific antibody production after immunization (if applicable)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the B lymphocyte compartment
primary_outcome.description: analysis of the circulating B cell subpopulations by flow cytometry: total CD19+ cells, naive (CD19+IgD+CD27-), switched memory (CD19+IgD-CD27+), marginal zone (CD19+IgD+CD27+), transitional (CD19+IgD+CD27-CD24highCD38+), 21low (CD19+CD38-CD21low). Immunoglobulin levels (IgG, A, M and E) and specific antibody production after immunization (if applicable)

secondary_outcome.measure: End of ongoing infection before the transplantation

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse event will be measured using CTCAE

arm_group.description: Autologous purified CD34+ cells transduced with a self-inactivated lentiviral vector, expressing the DCLRE1C gene (alias Artemis)

intervention.description: Each patient will receive a single intravenous infusion of ARTEGENE drug product at D0.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient less than one year
- SCID patients with confirmed biallelic mutations in the Artemis (DCLRE1C) gene
- Absence of an HLA genoidentical donor or without rapidly available HLA-compatible unrelated donor (within six weeks of diagnosis)
- The patient can be treated by gene therapy without delay in case of active life threatening infections compromising the short-term prognosis and for which the delay in finding a phenoidentical donor is incompatible with the patient's condition of health. Active life threatening infections are defined as: viral respiratory infection, CMV infection, adenovirus infection, disseminated BCGitis or other infections grade ≥ 4 according to CTCAE scale
- Parental, guardian's patient signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria
- Unwillingness to return for follow-up during the first 2 years study and the long term follow-up
- HIV-1 or 2 or HTLV1 infections
- Hypersensitivity to nivestim or busulfan
- Unable to tolerate general anesthesia and/or marrow harvest or peripheral blood stem cell collection (apheresis) or insertion of central venous catheter.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Biotherapy,LTCG, Necker-Enfants Malades Hospital

facility.name: Department of Pediatric Immunology, Hematology and Rheumatology UIHR, Necker-Enfants Malades Hospital
